exuber 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
  • News

Get House Price Data

Source: R/get.R
ukhp_get.Rd

Get House Price Data

ukhp_get(region = "england", item = "housePriceIndex", regexp = TRUE,
  start_date = NULL, end_date = NULL, ...)

Arguments

region

the region to select. If regexp is set to FALSE then the matching should be exact, see ukhp_avail_regions for available regions. If regexp is set to TRUE then partial matching is possible. Furthermore it is set to NULL selects all available regions.
item

the item to select. See ukhp_avail_items for the available categories.
regexp

use regular expression in sparql to search for regions.
start_date

the start date
end_date

the end date
...

query modifiers passed through rdf_modifiers.

See also

rdf_modifiers

Examples

# \donttest{
# This is case sensitive
ukhp_get("england")
#> # A tibble: 1,245 x 3
#>    region  date       housePriceIndex
#>    <fct>   <date>               <dbl>
#>  1 england 1968-04-01            1.68
#>  2 england 1968-04-01            1.68
#>  3 england 1968-04-01            1.68
#>  4 england 1968-07-01            1.74
#>  5 england 1968-07-01            1.74
#>  6 england 1968-07-01            1.74
#>  7 england 1968-10-01            1.73
#>  8 england 1968-10-01            1.73
#>  9 england 1968-10-01            1.73
#> 10 england 1969-01-01            1.76
#> # ... with 1,235 more rows

# However you can use regular expression instead of exact match
ukhp_get("england", regexp = TRUE)
#> # A tibble: 1,245 x 3
#>    region  date       housePriceIndex
#>    <fct>   <date>               <dbl>
#>  1 england 1968-04-01            1.68
#>  2 england 1968-04-01            1.68
#>  3 england 1968-04-01            1.68
#>  4 england 1968-07-01            1.74
#>  5 england 1968-07-01            1.74
#>  6 england 1968-07-01            1.74
#>  7 england 1968-10-01            1.73
#>  8 england 1968-10-01            1.73
#>  9 england 1968-10-01            1.73
#> 10 england 1969-01-01            1.76
#> # ... with 1,235 more rows
